summary:
I am an epidemiologist currently employed in surveillance of respiratory disease from notifiable viral infections including SARS-CoV-2, Legionella, Psittacosis, and Q-fever.

My expertise and career focus lay in infectious disease epidemiology and related research in Caribbean settings.

BACKGROUND
I am an innovative, energetic and highly motivated young professional with a diverse medical background and a passion for prevention, tropical diseases, and island-focused policy and governance.

Originally from Curaçao, I graduated from University of Sheffield (Msc in International Public Health, merit) and from the French School of Public Health (MPH specialization in Epidemiology and Biostatistics, mention tres bien). Prior to that I achieved a Bsc in nursing summa cum laude from the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences, where I concentrated on Global Health, a one-year interdisciplinary excellence program, and a two-year Honours program Medicine.

EXPERTISE
As a former nurse, I have practical & medical expertise with COVID-19; adult (advanced) oncology; gastro-enterology; NCDs; neurology, including Parkinson and cerebral hemorrhage; orthopedics; and geriatrics. Additionally, I briefly researched Dutch vs. EU laws and regulation around testing medication for children as well as early onset neonatal sepsis. My practical experience includes hospital based care and (closed) geriatric care.

As an active researcher, I have thematic experience with examining geographic, social & gender-based inequalities, as well as researching maternal/neonatal/child survival, intimate partner violence, economic dependence, and assessing the impact of health promotion activities such as a national campaign targeting the prevention of violence/abuse/victim blaming amongst Dutch adolescents. Check out my CV for more on my methodological skills.

awards.title: David Picou Young Researcher Award
awards.description: I am grateful and blessed to have been awarded the David Picou Young Researcher Award for the “best oral presentation by an up and coming Caribbean researcher” at this year’s CARPHA conference.

awards.title: Cum Laude Bsc
awards.description: Graduated with a 4.0 GPA from the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences

awards.title: Honours programme Medicine
awards.description:
Succesfully completed a two-years honours programme in medicine by the University of Applied Sciences of Amsterdam as part of my Bsc. Focused on acute care and prevention.

Thesis: Neonatal sepsis (9.0)
Ethical essay: Testing medication on children: why not? (9.0)

projects.title: CARPHA 67th Annual Health Research Conference | April 2023 | Nassau, Bahamas
projects.description: In person conference in the Bahamas. Here, I presented on the findings of our two papers regarding long-COVID prevalence on Bonaire and the role of post-infection vaccination in alleviating persisting symptoms. I received an award for the best oral presentation, the David Picou Young Researcher Award.

projects.title: Dutch Caribbean Research Week | June 2022 | Online
projects.description: I presented on the design and primary results of the long-COVID study on Bonaire, Caribbean Netherlands during this 5-day digital event.

projects.title: International Health Regulations (IHR) Annual Regional Conference | June 2022 | Aruba, Dutch Caribbean
projects.description: For this conference, I assisted with the preparation and collection of evaluation reports from several Dutch Caribbean islands. During the conference, I assisted with the logistics, co-presented with my Bonairean colleague on the Bonaire long-COVID study design and primary results, as well as collaborated with a colleague from the RIVM laboratory on a presentation of the relevance of whole genomic sequencing in the Caribbean region.

projects.title: WEON Conference | June 2022 | Nijmegen, Netherlands
projects.description: I presented on the research methodology for the long-COVID study on Bonaire during a fringe session at the three-day WEON Conference at Radboud UMC in Nijmegen, the Netherlands. The pverall theme of the conference was "the art of epidemiology".

projects.title: CARPHA 65th Annual Health Research Conference | June 2021 | Online
projects.description: Attended the four-day conference digitally. I did not present at this conference. The overall theme of the conference was "Pandemic, NCDs and Climate Change: The Caribbean's Triple Threat".

profile_positions.company: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment
profile_positions.description:
Epidemioloog bij het Centrum Infectieziektenbestrijding (Cib) afdeling Epidemiologie en Surveillance van Respiratoire Infectieziekten.

• Nov 2020 - huidig: De (coördinatie van) surveillance van COVID-19 in de overzeese Rijksdelen (CAS-BES eilanden). Als epidemioloog in het COVID-team werk ik samen met de gezondheidsautoriteiten op de CAS en BES (ei)landen aan de monitoring en surveillance van de COVID-19-epidemie. Mijn verantwoordelijkheden t.o.v. de eilanden betreffen o.a. de coordinatie, analyse en rapportage van COVID-19 (kiem)surveillance en vaccinatiedata, technische ondersteuning of adviezen geven en het (mee)schrijven van wetenschappelijke publicaties omtrent de uitbraak en pandemische paraatheid in het Caribisch deel van het Koninkrijk.

• Mei 2021 - huidig: Eerste onderzoeker binnen het long-COVID onderzoek op Bonaire.

• Juni 2021 - Maart 2023: HERA1 - ECDC project t.b.v. de versterking van laboratorium capaciteit op Aruba en Curaçao.

• Maart 2022 - huidig: Europees Nederlandse COVID-19 surveillance. 

• Augustus 2022 - Maart 2023: (de coördinatie van) Monkeypox surveillance in Caribisch Nederland. 

• Januari 2023 - huidig: Landelijke sterftemonitoring. 

• Maart 2023 - huidig: Project gerelateerd aan de informatie-uitwisseling met verpleeghuizen t.b.v. monitoring infectieziekten.

• Mei 2023 - huidig: Surveillance van Legionella, Psittacose en Q-koorts.
profile_positions.title: Epidemiologist | Epidemioloog

company.name: Atria kennisinstituut voor emancipatie en vrouwengeschiedenis

profile_positions.company: Atria kennisinstituut voor emancipatie en vrouwengeschiedenis
profile_positions.description:
Junior researcher at ATRIA Institute on Gender Equality and Women's History. Tasks included collecting and presenting (scientific) data; supporting researchers by carrying out quantitative and qualitative research, developing research proposals, assisting policy advisers; and developing scientific graphs and charts.

Competences: Planning | Flexibility | Expression | Teamwork | Analytical | Proactive | Independence

RESEARCH
•	Qualitative impact evaluation of a national public health campaign aiming to improve perceptions of Dutch adolescents to increased awareness and acceptance of positive attitudes and expressions around sexual consent and the prevention of (sexual, physical, or gender-based) violence. Dissemination of results through presentation with stakeholders.

•	Quantitative analysis of a national-level quasi-randomised study (longitudinal). Coordination of primary data collection. Preliminary quantitative data analysis using SPSS. Guidance of interns involved with the project.

•     Primary author of a fact sheet on (trends of) economic dependence of women in The Netherlands. Not published.

•     Primary analyst for a national prevalence study on gender stereotypes and care division among Dutch couples and single-parents. Not published.

PUBLISHED RESEARCH
•	Secondary author of a literature review on economic dependence and IPV risk. Collaborated with the Dutch ministry of OCW & UvA University. See publications.

SKILLS ACQUIRED
•     Analytical (qualitative, quantitative, mixed methods)
•     Methodological (principal component analysis, discourse analysis, data mining, SPSS programming, Atlas.Ti coding)
•     Organisation (coordination of primary data collection at multiple sites in the country)
•     Collaboration (team member of several projects, external teamwork with Dutch ministries SZW, OCW)
profile_positions.title: Junior (Quantitative) Researcher | Junior (Kwantitatief) Onderzoeker

profile_positions.description:
Research intern at the Department of Evidence and Intelligence for Action in Health (EIH) at the PAHO Headquarters in Washington, DC, USA.

TASKS
•	Proposal development/protocol writing for a multi-country, predictive modeling analysis at subnational level (SDG 3)
•	Conduct an extensive literature review in various databases and grey literature (300+) in under two weeks
•	Critical appraisal of evidence for intervention effectiveness (systematic review or meta-analysis) for 24 interventions used in the Lives Saved Tool (LiST) model for our study, using ‘PRISMA’, ‘AMSTAR II’ and ‘Robis’ checklists
•	Identifying and managing health survey data from different Latin American and Caribbean (LAC) countries by creating a multi-country dataset disaggregated at the sub-national level by department (district) using Excel
•	Planning and carrying out LiST-based modelling of 24 interventions
•	Creating over 70 projections and carrying out over 70 departmental (district) level analyses utilizing the Lives Saved Tool (LiST) in Spectrum Software
•	Collaborating and communicating with experts in maternal and child mortality in the LAC region
•	Keeping co-authors informed of the study versions through bi-monthly (Skype) meetings
•	Report writing as primary author of this study (see details below)

RESEARCH
•	Berry, D., Moreno, C., Soliz, P., Duran, P., Sanhueza, A., Reveiz, L. Towards universal health: Estimating subnational maternal, neonatal, and under-five mortality reduction in Colombia and Peru. Pan American Health Organization (PAHO). *study not published*

•	Berry. D., Crépey, P., Reveiz, L. Eliminating within-country coverage inequalities and maternal, neonatal, and under-five mortality impact in Peru: A deterministic modelling approach. The University of Sheffield. Thesis. Master of Public Health. Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Santé Publique Paris. Master de Santé Publique. June 2019.   *not published*
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Graduate nursing intern on orthopedics & neurology/neurosurgery ward, high complexity care. All tasks performed under supervision of registered nurses. My tasks included patient admission and preoperative check-in; postoperative care of orthopedic patients, varying complexity of procedures; daily care and support with nutrition of neurology patients, varying complexity and severity of [co]morbidity; multidisciplinary collaboration, including but not limited to physiotherapists, nutritionists, pharmacists, psychologists, and doctors/surgeons from various specialties.
profile_positions.title: Nursing Student

profile_positions.description: Oncology & Gastroenterology, high complexity care. All tasks performed under supervision of registered nurses. My tasks included patient admission; postoperative care, medium to high complexity; daily care and support with nutrition, medium to high complexity and severity of [co]morbidity; multidisciplinary collaboration, including but not limited to physiotherapists, nutritionists, pharmacists, psychologists, and doctors/surgeons from various specialties.
profile_positions.title: Nursing student

volunteer_experiences.role: Youth Ambassador for The Netherlands | Jeugdambassadeur Nederland
volunteer_experiences.description:
ONE is a global movement campaigning to end extreme poverty and preventable disease by 2030. As youth ambassador, activities for 2020/2021 run will touch on advocacy, [inter]national campaigns, and policy. Within this volunteer position I will focus largely on activities surrounding Gavi the vaccine Alliance, ensuring financial investment into the availability of (covid19) vaccinations for developing countries in the AFRO region, and more. Check out my Twitter account to see more of my ONE advocacy activities @DanytzaBerry.

EVENTS, TRAININGS AND ACTIVITIES
Training: MFF budget, EU Council, progress towards SDGs. March 24th 2020.
Training: Social Media gebruik als Youth Ambassadeur. March 31st 2020.
Training by Jenny Ottenhof: GAVI The Vaccine Alliance. April 2nd 2020.
Training by Martina Nuti: Effective advocacy. May 13th 2020.
Training: ONE in Africa. June 11th 2020.
Training: Turn to Love. September 1st 2020.

Theme: "Improving the health of women, children and adolescents"

For this three-day simulation event I represented the Delegate of France in the WHO. This included discussing priorities within the EU region, drafting resolution papers, collaborating with other countries, collaborating on amending the resolution papers as well as presenting them in front of the jury. Certificate of Participation achieved.

During this academic year I filled the role of External Communications for EPHSA, which includes communicating with students and alumni, improving and maintaining the communications platform, facilitating Q&A sessions for current and future students and participating in monthly meetings with the board to discuss actions, elections and networking events; with the overall aim to represent the interests of students and alumni of the European Public Health Masters Program to further improve the program as well as improving the experience of students in the program.

In February 2019 I represented EPHSA together with two board members at the Annual Europubhealth+ Consortium Meeting in Sheffield, United Kingdom to represent our Association and discuss potential collaboration between Europubhealth+ and EPHSA. Presentation on EPHSA its mission and objectives as well as proposed initiatives for collaboration.

company.name: EHESP - École des hautes études en santé publique

volunteer_experiences.description:
Student representative for Epidemiology and Biostatistics students of the European Public Health Masters program during the 2018-2019 academic year at the French School of Public Health (EHESP). This includes facilitating communication between students and faculty, meeting with faculty (monthly) and leading feedback sessions to improve the program structure and quality for current and future students.

In February 2019 I represented the entire M2 cohort of Europubhealth+ at the Annual Europubhealth+ Consortium Meeting in Sheffield, United Kingdom to voice feedback from students of five partner institutions across Europe and facilitate discussion on improving the program for current and future Europubhealth+ students.

Theme: "Outbreaks and pandemics: Addressing the next crisis"

For this three-day simulation event I represented the Delegate of The Netherlands in the WHO. This included discussing priorities within the EU region, drafting resolution papers, collaborating with other countries, collaborating on amending the resolution papers as well as presenting them in front of the jury. Certificate of Participation achieved.

Fieldwork project in Sal, Cape Verde as part of the minor Global Health at the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences.
Research topic: The accessibility and availability of healthcare for inhabitants of Alto Santa Cruz in Sal, Cape Verde.

Board member of the nursing alumni association AnnA Amsterdam at the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences. I chose to end my role in the board early due to inactivity of other board members and lack of communication/intention to organize (educational) events for alumni.
